page.title: 10FARMING
page.content: There are six farms in our area, none of them bigger than 125 hectares.The farms are all mainly dairy and own from 110 to 150 cattle (mainly Friesian or Friesian crossed with Holstein) and 1 farm owned 12 beef cattle.The milk production per cow, per day is around 18 litres. Some farms grow arable crops in addition to silage for winter fodder. One farm also grows maize as fodder and another grows winter barley which he sells. The farms all employed under 5 people but only one employed no people.This is partly because the farms in the area are small and partly because the area is highly mechanised. The farms making the most money are the ones adopting to change. This changing has now become particularly noticable since the EEC (cont on p.11)
